missionProperties.repositionOverride: Block access to the dead drop.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

Your pilot drops you at an abandoned tibanna transport dock and leaves you with a warning, “I saw a modified TIE fighter landing down the way. Get moving, and I'll meet you on the catwalk." With the dead drop coordinates in hand, you move in to claim the Imperial codes.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} A Rebel figure can attack the door to the Observation Room (Health: *2*, Defense: 2 {G}).

eventActions.tbText:
Next to you, Lando Calrissian emerges from the shadows. The Baron Administrator's face is grim.

{-} Heroes control <color="red">Lando Calrissian</color> as an ally.
Behind the other troops you see Agent Blaise leading the search.
Coordinates in hand, you start looking for the dead drop.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The dead drop lies secure in the corner of the old holding cell.

{-} A Rebel figure can retrieve the dead drop.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} The Imperial mission token represents the dead drop. A Rebel figure can retrieve the dead drop.
{-} The mission will progress when the dead drop is retrieved.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.
A huge window leads to a dark corridor. This might be your way to your extraction point.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
A huge window leads into a corridor. The corridor is dark, so all you can see are your reflections.

{-} A Rebel figure can attack the window (Health: 1, Defense: None).
{-} If a figure is pushed into a space containing the window, destroy the window.

A huge window leads into a corridor. The corridor is dark, so all you can see are your reflections.

{-} A Rebel figure can attack the window (Health: 1, Defense: None).
{-} If a figure is pushed into a space containing the window, destroy the window.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} The neutral mission markers represent a window.
{-} A Rebel figure can attack the window (Health: 1, Defense: None).
{-} If a figure is pushed into a space containing the window, destroy the window.

events.eventText:
Out of breath and coursing with adrenaline, you | make the leap to your ship. That was more than you bargained for, but High Command will be grateful. Vader rages below. You watch him cut down several of his own reinforcements as your pilot speeds away.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} If playing this mission as a side mission, heroes receive the “Under the Radar” Reward card.

eventActions.mainText: Did you play this mission as part of the "The Bespin Gambit" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Unable to evade the overpowering Sith, you toss the codes on the floor, using the moment to climb out to the catwalk where your ship is waiting. Whatever those codes were, they were important enough for Darth Vader to be personally interested. This failure will cost the Rebellion dearly.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.mainText: Did you play this mission as part of the "The Bespin Gambit" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Having bested the ISB, the bounty hunter Bossk, and the now-fuming Darth Vader, you appreciate how valuable these Imperial codes must be. You begin the transmission to Rebel High Command immediately.

Lando sighs heavily. “I'm glad we recovered those codes, but there’s something you should probably hear from me first. When they decypher that mess, my name is going to come up more than a few times. My smugglers haven't always been... ethical, and I was hoping to keep that in the past.”

The confession unravels a series of deceptions. Lando returned to Cloud City to cover his tracks and tricked you into helping. Your trust is shaken, but High Command recovered critical intelligence, and the Rebellion gained the services of Lando Calrissian and his smugglers. This could be a turning point in the war.

You stare off into the clouds, watching the beldons glide. It’s easy to forget what peace looks like.

{-} The Rebels win the campaign!

A weary Lando makes the jump to the ship first. Before anyone else can board, the ship rumbles and starts to tailspin.

“Do not toy with me!” Darth Vader commands, hand grasping the air. “Give me the real codes.”

Over the com, you can hear your pilot choking as the ship continues to tumble. Now with no means of escape, you embrace your fate and rush the Sith lord. He drops his hand to engage you. As he swings his lightsaber, you hear a sullen Lando over the com, “I'm sorry for how this all turned out. I swapped the codes for a fake during the commotion. I want you to know that these codes will help turn the war, and that you wont be forgotten. I... I'm sorry.”

Every Rebel knows the risks, and that the cause is worth it. You see the ship fly off toward the sunset before feeling the lightsaber.

Long live the Rebellion.

{-} The Rebels lose the campaign.

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
The door is reduced to splinters.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
This doors leads into the Observation Room. It is locked tight.

{-} A Rebel figure can attack this door (Health: *2*, Defense: 2 {G}).

events.eventText: Behind the door lies a narrow catwalk leading out over Cloud City's central abyss. Strong winds threaten to throw you off the platform. You need to be careful.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The door leads out onto the dangerous catwalk where you are supposed to be extracted.

events.eventText: The window shatters in a shower of razor-sharp shards. Behind lies a dimly-lit corridor.

A huge window leads into a corridor. The corridor is dark, so all you can see are your reflections.

{-} A Rebel figure can attack the window (Health: 1, Defense: None).
{-} If a figure is pushed into a space containing the window, destroy the window.

{-} When a figure moves between the Observation Room and the Corridor, that figure suffers 1 {C}.
{-} The firs time a Rebel figure enters the Corridor, click the red highlight and select "Enter Corridor".

events.eventText: You see your pilot hovering slightly over the catwalk.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Your pilot hovers slightly over the catwalk, waiting for you.

{-} A Rebel figure carrying the dead drop can escape through the extraction point on the Catwalk.

events.eventText: A door is violently blasted open. In the frame stands the dark silhouette of none other but Darth Vader.

eventActions.customText: {-} When <color="red">Darth Vader</color> moves adjacent to a door, destroy that door.

eventActions.tbText:
The stories do him no justice. The towering Sith Lord marches forward. He does not flinch and does not pause as he cuts through anything in his path.

{-} <color="red">Darth Vader</color> cannot suffer {H} or gain Harmful conditions.
{-} When <color="red">Darth Vader</color> moves adjacent to a door, destroy that door.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The first time a Rebel figure enters the Corridor, click "Enter Corridor".

events.eventText:
As you enter the corridor, heavy locks slide over the door to the Catwalk.

{-} The door to the Catwalk is locked. A Rebel figure can interact with the door ({I}) to try and open it.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The door leads out onto the dangerous catwalk where you are supposed to be extracted.

{-} The door is locked. A Rebel figure can interact with the door ({I}) to try and open it.

events.eventText: As you enter the corridor, alarms ring out through the facility.
As you enter the corridor, stormtroopers rush in to stop you.

eventActions.mainText:
You start to pick the lock on the door.

{-} Test{I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the door, then discard all strain tokens on the door. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
You make some progress, but the door stays locked.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the door for each {B} result gained.
